main.name: Ryan Campisi
main.bio: I am a 23 year old recent graduate from the University of Florida. I have a passion for education and technology and aim to contribute to the field of computer science in a meaningful way.
main.contactmessage: Feel free to contact me for any questions or concerns.

resume.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Computer Science & Mathematics

technologies.name: JavaScript
technologies.about: JavaScript is a versatile programming language commonly used for web development.

projects.title: Flame Picks
projects.description: Developed a full-stack sports prediction web application using React.js frontend and Flask/Python backend with SQLAlchemy database integration. Implemented user authentication, real-time game predictions, social sharing features, and a competitive scoring system with global leaderboards and achievement tracking.

projects.title: SoundSpace
projects.description: Developed a full-stack social media platform for musicians using Angular frontend and Go backend with MySQL database integration. Implemented comprehensive user authentication with bcrypt password hashing, file upload capabilities for music and images, and real-time social interaction features including likes, comments, and follower systems.

technologies.name: Python
technologies.about: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language known for its readability and versatility.

projects.title: Isomap Algorithm Analysis
projects.description: Implemented and visualized the Isomap dimensionality reduction algorithm on the s-curve dataset to demonstrate its effectiveness in preserving the global structure of non-linear data. Compared Isomap with PCA and t-SNE, highlighting the strengths and weaknesses of each algorithm in capturing both local and global data structures.
projects.course: MAS4115 - Linear Algebra for Data Science

projects.title: Flame Picks
projects.description: Developed a full-stack sports prediction web application using React.js frontend and Flask/Python backend with SQLAlchemy database integration. Implemented user authentication, real-time game predictions, social sharing features, and a competitive scoring system with global leaderboards and achievement tracking.

projects.title: WeatherViz
projects.description: Designed and developed a cross-platform desktop application with a Python frontend and Rust backend for interactive visualization of historical weather data. Implemented real-time heatmap interpolation, smooth timelapse playback, and a custom scalable UI.

technologies.name: C++
technologies.about: C++ is a powerful, high-performance programming language widely used for system/software development and game programming.

projects.title: Largest Subarray - Algorithm Analysis
projects.description: Analyzed and implemented multiple algorithms to solve the maximum subarray and maximum submatrix sum problems, including brute-force, dynamic programming (top-down and bottom-up), and optimized approaches. Compared time and space complexities, benchmarked performance on large datasets, and demonstrated the practical advantages of efficient algorithms for real-world data analysis.

projects.title: Custom File System
projects.description: Implemented a custom userspace file system using FUSE to provide read/write access to classic PC game WAD files. Developed a C++ library to parse, represent, and manipulate WAD file directory structures, supporting file and directory creation, navigation, and data storage.

projects.title: Geographic Information System (GIS)
projects.description: Developed an object-oriented C++ application to model, store, and query convex polygons for GIS data. Implemented efficient point-in-polygon algorithms, file parsing, and a user-facing interface for spatial queries, supporting modular design and automated testing.

technologies.name: Java
technologies.about: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language that is designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible.

projects.title: Custom Programming Language
projects.description: Designed and implemented a complete compiler for a custom image processing programming language in Java, featuring lexical analysis, parsing, type checking, and code generation.

projects.title: Race Car Simulator
projects.description: Developed an object-oriented Java application simulating a car race using Swing for graphical animation. Designed classes to model car objects, manage their movement, and render them within a dynamic GUI.

projects.title: Order Management System
projects.description: Developed a comprehensive Java Swing application for a pizza restaurant's order management system. Implemented object-oriented design with multiple GUI panels for pizza size selection, topping selection, and order summary.

technologies.name: Kotlin
technologies.about: Kotlin is a modern, statically typed programming language that is fully interoperable with Java and is used for Android development, server-side development, and more.

projects.title: Memory Maker for Pet Lovers
projects.description: Designed and implemented an Android app for pet owners to save, favorite, and share photo memories with their pets. Built features including RecyclerView, fragments, SQLite storage, photo capture, and sharing via intents. Enabled users to filter, edit, and delete memories within a clean, multi-activity UI.

projects.title: Who Wants to Be a Thousandaire?
projects.description: Developed an Android trivia game app inspired by 'Who Wants to Be a Millionaire,' featuring multiple activities, explicit intents, and a multi-screen flow. Programmed game logic for question progression, quitting, and scoring, and applied best practices in Android development and model class design.

projects.title: Adventure Game
projects.description: Implemented a text-based Android adventure game in Kotlin. Engineered room navigation, a tavern with unique logic, player inventory, lootable rooms, and monster battles. Utilized object-oriented design, data classes, and custom commands for looting, inventory, and tavern interaction.

technologies.name: TypeScript
technologies.about: TypeScript is a strongly typed programming language that builds on JavaScript, giving you better tooling at any scale.

publication.title: Burnside's Lemma for Analysis of Error-Correcting Codes

education.school: Lakewood High School - Center for Advanced Technology

work.company: United States Department of the Navy
work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Facilitating the development and management of courseware for the United States Navy.

work.title: Expert AI Data Trainer
work.description: Collaborating closely with a team of fellow expert trainers, AI developers, and researchers, actively influencing the ongoing development of the AI model itself. Providing insights, feedback, and expertise that directly contributed to the evolution of the AI, making the role intellectually stimulating and instrumental in pushing the boundaries of AI technology.

work.title: Mathematics Tutor
work.description: Responsible for conducting private appointment tutoring for various math courses, including Calculus, Linear Algebra, and Differential Equations. I also led weekly Calculus review sessions for NROTC students.

work.company: UF Herbert Wertheim College of Engineering
work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: Assisted the Machine Learning & Sensing Lab on a project involving underwater hydrophones to research and understand coral reef ecosystems from an acoustics perspective.

work.title: Math Success Leader / Peer Coach
work.description: Responsible for leading weekly class sessions for Calculus students, grading Calculus papers, and conducting private appointment advising for STEM students looking to be successful in their transition to UWF.

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Ryan Campisi must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
